title: Hertz Shares List on Nasdaq as Investor Enthusiasm for Rental-Car Firms Rises
sub_head: Once-bankrupt company starts trading its shares under ticker symbol HTZ
body:
Hertz Global Holdings Inc., the rental-car company that emerged from bankruptcy this summer, listed on the Nasdaq on Tuesday with shares down 6% in midday trading.
The company late Monday priced the shares in the public offering at $29 apiece, on the high end of a previously targeted range, and said it would increase the size of the offering to 44.52 million shares, from 37.1 million announced last week.
